pageContext.claim: “Election authorities in Texas have repeatedly blocked the deployment of Dominion systems due to concerns about security, vulnerabilities and the potential for errors and outright fraud.”
pageContext.analysis: Texas did decide not to use Dominion machines but Trump overstates the reason. "Each of the Secretary of State’s three reports — conducted in August of 2012, January of 2019, and October of 2019 — indicate potential security issues were, at most, a secondary concern," reported The Texan. "Ryan Vassar, general counsel with the Office of the Attorney General (OAG), wrote, 'Both during and after the examination, the examiners raised specific concerns about legal compliance, including numerous technical and mechanical issues.'”
